SAMPLE NOTES
TOPIC: saguaro cactus (example of a plant that adapts well to its environment)
three ways that it adapts to its environment:
root structure (shallow and spread over wide area to absorb a lot of water)
slowed growth (needs little food and water)
ability to expand and contract (contracts during dry weather and expands during wet weather to make water last)
